ActImmigration and Refugee Protection Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
PrecisRegulations Amending the IMMIGRATION AND REFUGEE PROTECTION REGULATIONS in order to (1) bind all immigration decision-makers to findings of fact established as part of decisions made by Canadian criminal courts in certain circumstances, and to findings of fact that were accepted during a sentencing hearing in situations where those facts were cited as aggravating factors under subparagraph 718.2(a)(iv) of the Criminal Code because the offence was committed for the benefit of, at the direction of, or in association with a criminal organization; and (2) ensure consistency between serious inadmissibility for organized criminality and the serious inadmissibility related to security and human or international rights violations.
